page.title: 20Personal view of Wimbish.
page.content: I came to Wimbish in 1967 when I was appointed Headmaster of the Village School. Over the years I have seen many changes.As the indigenous population die or move away they are replaced with people who stay for a short while and then move on.Years ago many villagers were related.This is not so now.When youngsters leave school many move away to find work which is no longer available near home.The cost of homes are rising and with the news that nearby Stansted Airport is to be enlarged will rise even more.Young people cannot afford to buy homes in their own village.For the old, life is hard. They become reliant on others for shopping or going to the Doctor.Those who can, move away to a town.The village is now less of a community as many only come home at night to sleep.{F.J.Haslock.}
